text: Scirpophaga auristrigellus is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by George Hampson in 1896. It is found in Guangxi, China, India and Bhutan. The wingspan is 20–26 mm. The forewings are pale yellow, but yellow between the veins. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1896 Category:Schoenobiinae Category:Moths of China Category:Moths of India Category:Moths of Bhutan
title: Scirpophaga auristrigellus
